Order 3 times for a 3 item check? OK. Now we are waiting forever again. The 2 bartenders are talking to 4 people with balloons ignoring everyone else at the bar. I tell my girlfriend "I bet our food is just dieing in the window while she talks". My girlfriend goes and looks in the kitchen, sure enough there's out food. Bonnie has to ask 5 times and get loud before the bartender realizes someone else exists other than her friends. She brings our food, now lukewarm at best. We eat, and sit there forever again until I go up to the bar and ask for our check. There are 2 bartenders and 6 people at the bar, but yet I can't get my bill? The bartender is not happy and gives some shity smirk before she rings me up. Then when she hands me a check she says"Just so you know we don't have waitresses". Why are you serving food then? How the fuck am I supposed to order if there is no service? Do I go to the kitchen and order? Or do I go to the computer and put my order in? As stated I liked this place and have been going there since they opened. But since there are no waiters to serve me anymore I won't be eating there anymore. Good luck treating the few customers you have like shit.

SA6VpUZiG29LneMTa9Xu6g.review_text: I was super excited to come here, having heard about their great tater tots and tasty cocktails. And, well, that much is true. Ladies and gentlemen, they have great tater tots and tasty cocktails. My fella and I had the Seek and Destroy and the Cloak and Dagger drinks (MMM!), which were very creative and paired interesting flavors together: rum-chartreuse-pineapple-mint for the former and whiskey-blackberries-mint for the latter.  But there are problems. For one, we got a 3-tot sampler as an appetizer, and this was definitely listed under "appetizers." When we ordered, the server had told us that the normally $15 sampler would be "priced up" for the more expensive kinds of tots, so we figured the difference would be $4-5 extra.   Believing this to be a typical appetizer-sized appetizer, we also ordered entrees: the burger with Swiss cheese for me, and 12 BBQ wings for him. We expected maybe 7-10 each of the Wild Hare tots, buffalo chicken, and totchos. What we got was a plate of THREE full orders of each kind of tot. While you might say, awesome, what a deal, it was shocking. We gaped at the plate and when the server came back, asked if the entree orders had not been put in yet, to cancel them. The kitchen had already started cooking them, so we just had them put straight into to-go boxes.  The tots were totally good, though the totchos (tater tots covered in nacho fixins) were little more than novelty. The Wild Hare are basically poutine tots, which is always great in my book, and the buffalo chicken sauce was pretty tasty. But it was just huge. This is a two-person meal. And it was NOT $4-5 extra, the sampler came out to $25. Which is essentially $3 off of actually ordering the three full orders of tater tots. Had this been what we were hoping to have for dinner, that would be great, but we had two other entrees in boxes, which ended up being the wrong order anyway.  Finally, the decor would lead one to believe that it's a classy, old-timey style gastropub, but the place contains 5 TVs showing ESPN. A strange and not quite fitting detail.

Duu2eOYkCeUBrO6GPQvo5w.review_text: Decent cocktails, nice bartenders, well-decorated big space - rather D-baggy marina crowd, won't be frequenting.

aaXANaiPk9xzMEqo3t5l_g.review_text: Neighborhood bar with good food (gastronomic bar?).  We had a LivingSocial coupon for brunch, from them that we wanted to use. We had a 1 hour 45 minute wait (yep!). I almost gave up, didn't want to eat there given how crowded it was, assuming service would be spotty.  We got excellent service, the staff didn't lose their cool the guy at the front was super cooperative and to top it off the food / drinks (try their "hugo") was excellent.  The service/staff deserves kudos!

3FAb-ch2K3K9uQz7N49ITA.review_text: Told my group the wait would be 30 minutes and that we could wait and we could start our bottomless mimosas (included with our livingsocial deal which brought us there) while we waited. 1.5 hours later they finally sat us. Food was good but they charged us separately for the mimosas ($80) on top of our voucher after we moved from the bar). Ripoff

Lzck7Im0rktjvJUZNmgHZw.review_text: As a former Solstice fan i had high hopes.. alas. The bar staff are as friendly and professional as ever, but clearly the new bar is not aimed at anyone who appreciated the pretty good food Solstice offered or said goodbye to their twenties a while ago. I had Chinese lettuce cups, the fact they were topped with chopped tomato should have warned me. My friend who eats pretty much anything has tatter tots, maybe okay to soak up way to many drinks but really not that good. My food was tasteless and pretty terrible; the first time in this space i have not eaten what I've ordered. My friends and i loved Solstice because it was a great place for a few drinks and some decent appetizers or a meal- we;d probably come here for a last drink or maybe before going to eat somewhere else, but not to eat. Or to talk, maybe because they got rid of a lot of the wood and soft furnishings but its unbelievably loud. I will give them a few more chances as they just opened, but the food can only get better...

Qza0EVW1J_k0u8BIqMRbHQ.review_text: Tater tots. I mean... tater tots. Any way you can imagine them.  We came here for a friend's bday happy hour/dinner. The drink selection was great, the menu is great and their food is pretty darn good. We got a table right away at 6pm (but it got really busy around 8pm- this was a Thursday night). I really liked the atmosphere and the vibe and the location is pretty nice as well.  I would definitely come back here for drinks and dinner as there were several other things on the menu I wanted to try. But I'm telling you- try the tater tots.

x2mNTY-gX06kocOTJiYygA.review_text: Went here last night for dinner and drinks....Basically i ordered a Tri Tip which i chewed like gum for 30 mins...its was disgusting and the waitress was a disgrace.....She never came over once to see if we wanted anything...there was 12 of us and she was useless...We spent the whole time looking for her and waiting for drinks....If she had done her job properly, we probably would have spent a couple of 100 dollars more...This place is nothing to write home about...Only go here if you have to.

4RUXeyp_Af2C5t9JFyJlBQ.review_text: Decent place. Came here after a great lunch, then early happy hour, and this was the last stop of the night. Ton of seating - and on a Wednesday night, it ended up filling up pretty quickly.   I ordered the tatchos. I will say that I wish she had told me (or the menu showed) what the toppings were because I hate olives. HATE OLIVES. and I wish I could have told her none on my dish. My coworkers were a little healthier with the salads, and they looked great (and pretty big as well).   I wish that the waitress had told me that my drink was going to be a little spicy because then I wouldn't have ordered it. It was like a margarita but spicy and it was just awkward. I probably had too much to drink at that point, anyways, that night, so it was a good idea to stop.   BTW, apparently Wild Hare is the name of one of the director's baseball or softball team. Cute.

TRpI4fgC5SAZzjKV2iRSMQ.review_text: I live 2 blocks away from Wild Hare and I must admit that it is the main reason I come here so often. Its a central place to meet friends and there is almost always a table available. The staff is nice but the service tends to be a bit slow and the food is just okay.   There are tons of tv's so if you are looking to watch a game, it's a good spot for that.   They are also coming up with new deals, like taco Tuesday, which I believe will be $20 for 20 tacos...we will see how good they are!

K1NLdTfT1IizE-6smhsSug.review_text: 1 star for the food and drinks and extra star for the nice server that is not to blame.   Just walked out of the joint with the worse tummy ache and horrible end to the beginning of my Saturday funday.  Craving a Bloody Mary and so I start off with that. So damn salty it was undrinkable. Returned it and got one of the tequila grapefruit drinks which was okay.   Craving a Ruben sammie. Ordered and was delivered a pile of fat in between white un-toasted bread. So disappointing. Ended up dissecting my lunch just so I could cut apart the meat to separate the massive amounts of fat. It was nasty. Ate the sauerkraut and fries which were decent.  We walked out after the soap dispenser in the bathroom exploded all over my shirt. Just not the best day at Wild Hare. Now home and grumpy with horrible stomach pains. Ugh. Thanks for the waste of money and calories. Not coming back in awhile.

mS-4O56dx6wt5fWxbbx-LQ.review_text: Love this new Pac Heights hot spot. Maybe I'll finally be motivated to hang out with my Pac Heights friends in their own neighborhood!  It's perfect to unwind after work over some cocktails/beer and some tantalizing bites. It's also perfect to add onto your Friday/Saturday bar hopping spree.   They have a great selection of cocktails - describe what you're in the mood for and your waiter/bartender will guide you to the perfect pick. However, what primarily differentiates Wild Hare from its competitors is the delicious bar food. I tried the fried chicken bucket, mac and cheese and the fish tacos, all of which were equally delicious.   So not only is Wild Hare a watering hole, but its also an eating hole, if that's even a thing. Give it a whirl on your next trip to Pac Heights!  P.S. There are a lot of tables to sit down with large groups of friends so you won't have to stand by the bar during peak hours - total bonus points in my book!

rocDFDgw5uO594m9J_Ztpg.review_text: Used to be a huge fan but on Sunday the service was unforgivable and embarrassing. A party of 10 arrived at 11am on Sunday, we mentioned that we tried to make a reservation but never heard back and they sat us down at the high table in front. We proceeded to order and drink bottomless mimosas (which were small and they were slow to fill them up) for an hour and a half when our waitress came over and said that she made a huge mistake and we were sitting at a reserved table and we had to get up right away. She said we could stand and wait for another table and hold our food (that was already untouched and already getting cold). They continued to apologize but no solution was offered and the manager said that we should still have to pay. We were forced to walk across town and had a delightful brunch and bottomless at Harry's on Fillmore which has way better food anyways. Avoid Wild Hare at all costs.

x1bWGa-W8PXmmKwynf9Rcg.review_text: It started off poorly until we met Clare! She was the greatest! Enjoyed our meals and the bottomless mimosas. Basil and blueberry was good!! Fun spot but make sure you get Clare

qoGi6_Yya5PUEZu7gcGbwg.review_text: It's a bar with bar food. That said the food is pretty good. Crab jalapeño poppers while not very crab tasting were made with real jalapeños and had quite the ass kick. Fried chicken was slightly sweet, cooked perfectly and of course served in an actual bucket. Grilled cheese wasn't all the way melted but tomato soup was great. Didn't get one of the many tater tot options but will next time. Great music. Punch bowls if that's your thing and beer in jars. Decent for a quick bite and a brew

6ukodHcVxcl2FxlAPPi-tQ.review_text: Tasty cocktails and delicious food. But when paying $11 for a cocktail, you expect a decent service standard. Our server was MIA for 30 minutes and we had to make an active effort to hail down our server when our glasses emptied. Will not return, would not recommend.

4rscUhRnHPie0Uv3VEcoOQ.review_text: I've been in SF long enough to have experienced this space three times. 1st was the best (Razzela's), 2nd was great (Solstice), and sadly, this round has gone down hill. I think if we would just have had drinks, we'd be fine. It's the menu that needs (a lot) of work.  Basically... imagine going to Trader Joe's and buying a bag of pre-washed kale and iceberg lettuce. Now imagine bringing it to the back of a restaurant kitchen, opening it, and pouring half and half of each into a large bowl (and maybe not even freshening it up). Then sprinkle on some parmesan. And some pre-made grilled chicken. And bottled dressing that you don't really toss in. That's their version of a Caesar.  Moving on, imagine buying Trader Joe's mac-n-cheese in bulk and serving it from the microwave from said restaurant kitchen. As in, when it hits the table, it's already gelled.  You get the gist. Burgers were decent (I think someone actually cooked them), corn dogs decent.  Management: You have a wonderful space Wild Hare: please make tasty use of it to match your lovely cocktail menu and bar.

TLJZzsqtDW-loSGsuvTcwg.review_text: The only reason I would come back here is for a mediocre happy hour drink.   We got food here and......yuck. The coleslaw was super mayo-filled. The "tachos" are gross, a pile of tater tots with fake cheese and crappy canned nacho toppings. We also got the gimmicky "bucket of fried chicken." Four pieces of previously frozen fried chicken came in some circus-looking bucket. The breast was ice cold in the middle and when we sent it back, they just dropped that same piece in the fryer and brought back a super dark re-fried chicken breast.   Yuck.

tlSw5qoLmkNzzEvFXLROog.review_text: Came with some friends on the weekend.  Unfortunately they do not accept reservations for parties under 10 so we waited for over an hour.  It's a loud atmosphere and caters to those who brunch without really wanting to converse with their friends.   Ordered the totchos, 2 burgers, dungenous scramble and salad. We also ordered drinks. While the drinks, scramble and salad were ok one of the burgers was ordered with no cheese but came with it. When I reminded the staff they took it away and brought it back within a minute and there were still some cheese on it. They just peeled it off - I just hope not with their fingers - oh well....  The service was slow but at least the bottomless mimosas lived up to their names.  Probably will not be back.

l20MTXXZq6ydgig4cPBK3A.review_text: Wild Hare is supposed to be an ode to Alice and Wonderland, which had me stoked to head down the rabbit hole.   Disappointing at best, Wild Hare leaves almost everything to the imagination. It's almost as if the theme was an afterthought-- it's just like any other bar on divisidero, stuffy, filled with drunk 20-somethings, uninspired. Uninspiring.

37LPw7HeiAa9-fcK5Tp3cg.review_text: Friends & I purchased a groupon-type deal for this place that was an amazing bargain. For $25, we got two entrees, two bottomless spritzes, and a shot. Normally, the bottomless spritzes alone are $18, so we were excited to use our deal here. Unfortunately the experience was a little disappointing. We arrived around 1115 since we knew from other reviews that this place would be crowded and still ended up waiting about 45 minutes. While we waited, we started our bottomless beverages at the bar, so that helped to make up for it. However, the bar was crowded so we had to stand the entire time. Additionally, a group had reserved a certain number of seats, then told the staff that a certain number wasn't coming, and so the host led us to sit next to them. (Which I wasn't thrilled about, as the tables weren't separated.) Right as he led us down to our seats, the other group responded that the rest of their reservation was, indeed, coming. IMO, if you tell a host that they're not coming, then you lose your reservation, especially in a place with a very long waiting list. However, the host obliged and apologized to us instead and said we would be next up. Fine, whatever. We'll just have another drink. We did sit down about ten minutes later and got immediate refills in our drinks. I didn't really like the champagne they used as it was too bitter and didn't add much flavor besides that. The drinks are truly spritzers, ie, they are not heavy on the taste at all. I was very exciting to try to Hugo but was disappointed. Honestly, they tasted watered down. I will say that they were great about getting us refills, though. The food was unremarkable at best. My friend ordered a veggie scramble and was served a crab scramble. My breakfast burrito arrived cold and didn't have any flavor to it. Country potatoes were meh. My companions had similar experiences with their food, including scrambles, breakfast sandwiches, and the hash. We did, however, love the tater tots - they were fried perfectly and had a great garlic taste to them. They were the favorite. The shot we had was Fireball and was so good we decided to get another round, which I believe cost in the vicinity of $25 (expensive for a low grade liquor.) The place was packed with the typical 20-something mixed bag San Fran crowd. Music was a plus. It was one of those "hip" places, you know, where you can go to pick up a one night (day?) stand and hope it turns into something real. We won't return. It's not worth the price or the wait.

sjXC5pTebfGMZzP-9fpxTw.review_text: Bro central with. So. Much. Tater tots. It comes with everything! The rainbow array of mimosas is super classy and awesome.

u_38Wg1EZ0LrysSta5FM7g.review_text: The Mac and cheese is delicious! The corn dogs dipped in mustard are glorious. The crab jalapeño poppers are uber spicy - watch out!

mgof5X-rGvqsOMKSmsCU_A.review_text: Come on down the rabbit hole! Friendly staff and fun cocktails in a quasi-Alice meets the Queen of Hearts setting. With the Big Buck Hunter Pro arcade and free wifi, this place gets 6 stars in my book.

klPSHRgkCHyNAtGlN1Wuow.review_text: Lightning with fewer douchebags and much better service. Tip: they play the sound on football games, plus!

MaZ4V9imUIjA6Neqq01fmQ.review_text: Went in for Sunday brunch. Food was great. Atmosphere was fun. Service was fantastic . Im 50 and my daughter's 26. It was perfect for both of us.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Supposedly, this place should've rocked it being owned by the same guys who started Bullitt, Tonic and Dr. Teeth in the Mission.  The food is not good.  Save for the tater tots and truffled popcorn, everything else was a miss. The burger was a fail ... please don't put a ciabatta bun on a grass fed burger!  Your "poutine" needs work.  Your corn dogs are a disgrace!  The drinks?!  I actually liked my Daybreaker made with vodka (gasp!), strawberries and aperol.  But you totally ruined my friend's Old Fashioned by putting cherries and oranges in it.  Obviously, you guys have never seen an episode of Mad Men!  I appreciated the nice service but I basically wasted $80 worth of hard earned cash here. Bring back Solstice instead!

HKC-j6ShF_wUfB0q1BH5cw.review_text: Wild Hare, are you a bar, restaurant, brunch place, dating (Tinder!) hot spot, or all of the above? I'm not sure. Apparently it's the number one Tinder bar in the city (if you don't know what Tinder is, good for you).   I'd say get here early on a weekend to continue your clubbing tour from the nite before (loud and pumpin' electro music) and/or keep on drinking (full bar).  On the other hand, you can also get decent brunch/breakfast here (Eggs Benedict, $10) , only the coffee seems a bit overpriced ($4.50 per cup). Portion size was good and food came super fast.  Downside: the service - waited for about 20 minutes without being recognized by the one waitress serving the whole place, which wasn't packed at all at 11.30am on a Sunday.   The bar is intriguing though and I'll definitely give it a shot next time (literally).

rVs5Ttf3TcjX952G289c9w.review_text: Was in the neighborhood and wanted a drink after a hot day and shopping haha. Stumbled into Wild Hare and was very, very pleased. Really hard to get seats (there was a Giants/Niners game on), but I enjoyed their Greyhound (with freshly squeezed grapefruit juice) and they had these amazing tator tots. I think they were their tator tot nachos (instead of nachos, they used tator tots, which I'd much rather eat.) Nom nom nom!

iFXMgBuqkF6w9cIIqpBS3A.review_text: I had my first experience at Wild Hare this past Labor Day weekend & it was interesting. Not great, not horrible, but just OK.  We went for bottomless mimosa/spritzer brunch on Saturday at 12pm. The place was completely dead, which I thought was weird (but it was a 3-day weekend, so that explains it). But since the place was dead, you would think the service would be great, right? NOT THE CASE.  The service was slow & shotty. Our waitress while really nice but ordered 1/2 the tables food at one time, then did the other half at another point. Weird. Then, for bottomless mimosas I constantly had to ask for refills. What's the whole point of BOTTOMLESS if I'm constantly asking for refills? Sorry for being a whiny B, but I'm trying to get day drunk!  The food & drinks (when I had one) were pretty good! Big menu with lots of options for all diets. I ordered Chipotle Eggs Benedict & it was delish! My friend also ordered Totchos to share and they were SO GOOD! I also enjoyed the variety of spritzers -- my favorite was The Hugo.   We stayed all afternoon until bottomless ended (3PM) & I left happy, but not drunk like I have at other restaurants. While the food was good & they had a good variety of things available, I'll probably go elsewhere for bottomless & brunch in the future!

hJ6oyFylKAE004-6IbdezQ.review_text: I came here with the wife and friends. They kindly accepted two groupons which was awesome. The service I have to admit made up for what was lacking. The people working there are sooo happy and wow talk about never letter your bottomless mimosa sit empty. They kept filling it even without asking.  The bad parts. I really wanted to love this place location great! Drinks and libations great! Nice digs inside, meh it was nice especially with the tvs and a great bar counter, service fantastic! food so-so. Sigh the food sounded sooo good on the menu. Friends did enjoy their breakfast sandwich and veggie omelet. I had the bis cuts and gravy, hmm bis cut was tepid at best but fresh but the gravy was cold and egg not that hot either. Wife had the marscapone french toast which was a mess and soggy. Eeeh the drinks made up for it and the fantastic service. I mean like amazing service.  I do definitely want to stop by for the taco Tuesdays!

xdRwm7nreWcnRI27-Vtnmw.review_text: Staff was super nice and a lot of fun.  The drinks were delicious and they were playing great music for the atmosphere.  I would totally come back to bring a group of friends before we head out or for the whole night.

NGdzcR5RaB_nVXaIBF1UJg.review_text: Purchased a LivingSocial- totally worth it! Wasn't too crowded at noon on a random Sunday, about half the rather large restaurant was filled.  I got the crab omelette, which honestly wasn't my favorite (hence the minus 1 star) though recommended by the waitress. Barely any crab, very saucy. I don't know. My friends ordered the beet/goat cheese salad with grilled chicken, however, and that was DELICIOUS. Coming back next time for that.  Bottomless mimosas were great since there are multiple bellinis/mimosas you can order, and the waitress kept coming around. We were in a huge group and they accommodated us! We also got a Fireball shot w/the LivingSocial.  I would come back without the LivingSocial deal, since service is great, the salads seem delicious, and the atmosphere is a great fun brunch place in Pac Heights. No complaints, very typical brunch-SF-SundayFunday feel!

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: New name, same "first date" spot. Loud and lively.  but for some reason, they have the heat up to an abnormally high level.  yes, we all know the rule about raising the temp and people take off more clothes, but seriously, it's like EIGHTY in here.   can we bring bathing suits tomorrow night?  (indoor pool, just a suggestion)

kCQRWc_C4F8pgQE_yVp1KQ.review_text: Really enjoyed the evening @ wild hare. Service was friendly and attentive. Surf and turf lettuce cup appetizer was excellent especially with a dab of Louisiana hot sauce. Battered fish tacos were well prepared, light and tasty even though I usually like the fish grilled. I would have preferred a broader beer selection but the 4 on tap were adequate. Also, the chopped salad could included more ingredients but nonetheless was fresh and a nice complement to the rest of the meal. Atmosphere was fun and lively. TVs were showing a couple ballgames so all was well. Definitely a solid thumbs up.
